Objective Function for CAFTA

Source: R/cafta.R
objective.Rd

Computes the penalized negative log-likelihood, gradient, and Hessian for accelerated failure time models with parametric distributions (Weibull, log-logistic, log-normal). The function also allows for robust covariance estimation.

Usage

objective(
  par,
  time,
  status,
  x,
  theta,
  hess,
  dist,
  robust = FALSE,
  eps = .Machine$double.eps
)

Arguments

par

Numeric vector of parameters.

time

Numeric vector of observed survival or censoring times.

status

Numeric vector indicating event occurrence.

x

Numeric matrix of covariates.

theta

Numeric vector of prior means for parameters (for penalization).

hess

Numeric matrix, prior Hessian matrix for penalization.

dist

Character string specifying the distribution. One of "weibull", "loglogistic", or "lognormal".

robust

Logical; if TRUE, computes robust covariance estimate and attaches it as an attribute.

eps

Numeric; small value to avoid division by zero or log of zero, default is the machine's double precision epsilon.

Value

A numeric value representing the penalized negative log-likelihood. The result has attributes:

gradient

Gradient vector of the objective function.

hessian

Hessian matrix of the objective function.

covariance

(If robust = TRUE) Robust covariance estimate.

Details

Computes the penalized negative log-likelihood for the specified accelerated failure time model. The returned value includes attributes "gradient" and "hessian" for use in optimization routines. If robust = TRUE, a robust covariance estimate is attached as the "covariance" attribute.
